title: App Settings
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user is on the Settings view

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on Set Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Home Screen Icon view
and the user will see a section with the current icon
and Personalize your home screen information text

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user has MLB icon as the current icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the Reset to MLB text is not highlighted
and not tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user has a team logo as the current icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the Reset to MLB text is highlighted in Favorite Team color
and the button is tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: and when a user has a Favorite team(s) set
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the favorite team(s) will be seen under it's own header

custom_steps_separated.content:
and when the user removes a favorite team
or changes the order of favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the favorite team(s) will be updated under it's own header

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user swipes down the Home Screen Icon page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the correct teams under the correct league and division

(i.e. AL East, AL Central, AL West, NL East, NL Central, NL West)

can refer to http://mlb.mlb.com/home > tap on Team in the header

custom_steps_separated.content: and when a user taps on a team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the Current Icon updates to the new team logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates with the new team name

custom_steps_separated.content:
and when a user has a team setup
and taps on another team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the Current Icon updates to the new team logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates with the new team name

custom_steps_separated.content: and when a user taps on Reset to MLB
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the Current Icon updates to the MLB logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates

title: Team Modal
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens At Bat
and selects a Favorite Team
and finishes on boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: then the user is on the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: and the user is presented with a Personalize your home screen modal

custom_steps_separated.content: then the modal text will be
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Personalize your home screen
Select the <Team> to be your home screen icon
Current Home Screen Icon
Not Now button

custom_steps_separated.content: then the modal will display
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Current logo (MLB.com icon)
Favorite Team logo

custom_steps_separated.content: then tapping on the favorite team's logo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
will update the team icon
and dismiss the modal

custom_steps_separated.content: then tapping Not Now
custom_steps_separated.expected: will dismiss the modal but doesn't update the user's icon

custom_steps_separated.content: if the user changed the favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see see the modal again for the new favorite team

title: Custom App Icon
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed
and a team custom app icon set

custom_steps_separated.content: Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Display the Custom App Icon

custom_steps_separated.content: Spotlight Search
custom_steps_separated.expected: Display the Custom App Icon

custom_steps_separated.content: Widget
custom_steps_separated.expected: Display the default MLB icon

custom_steps_separated.content: Notification
custom_steps_separated.expected: Notifications display with the default MLB shield icon

custom_steps_separated.content: Long press app icon on 3D Touch supported device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Display the default MLB icon

title: One Favorite Team
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user has a Favorite Team
and a user swipes down on the Team Page to Settings
and taps on Settings
custom_expected: Then the user is able to set that team as custom app icon

title: Customize App Icon Spanish Translations
custom_preconds:
When a user has two iOS devices
and one device is set to English
and one device is set to Spanish
and has At Bat installed on both
custom_steps:
When the user is in At Bat
and on the Custom App Icon views
custom_expected: When the user compares the screens, they will see the following English (left) - Spanish (right) correlations

custom_steps_separated.content: Set Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Asigna el ícono para la pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Personalize your home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Personaliza tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Select the Orioles to change the At Bat icon on your home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Selecciona los Orioles para cambiar el ícono de At Bat en tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Current Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ícono actual

custom_steps_separated.content: You’ve selected the Orioles as the At Bat icon on your home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Seleccionaste a los Orioles como el ícono de At Bat para tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Current Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ícono actual de tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Not Now
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ahora no

title: Deep Links
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When user has went through on boarding
custom_expected: and navigates to a deep link

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app killed
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app in the background
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app backgrounded on Gameday
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app backgrounded on a modal (with Done button)
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

title: Set App Icon Prompt
custom_preconds: * User has an account and authenticates the first time
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user has not already changed their app icon

WHEN they launch the app (that has this code in it) for the 3rd time (aka 3rd app launch)

THEN we will show this prompt on their default landing page asking them if they want to change their app icon
custom_expected: THEN we will show this prompt on their default landing page asking them if they want to change their app icon
